it's awesome, using it for two years now; find the easye17.sh script and compile from svn, or use the snapshot release; that is a bit outdated, either a new snapshot or first alpha release is coming soon

how about from the repos ?
that's the e17-svn package? that works, it installs the scripts and then compiles from svn
be prepared that some packages may have been removed from the svn tree, so you need to remove those from the list in the scripts (/usr/bin/easye17.sh and/or /etc/easye17.conf), than start again;
also there is some (sometimes slow) support in #e, good luck with it
